explanation: The report is correct. UtAssertEx forwards the File pointer to UtAssert_DoReport, which immediately calls strlen(File) without any prior validation. If a caller passes File == NULL this results in strlen(NULL) (undefined behavior / out-of-bounds access). Similarly, if File points to a non-terminated character array, strlen will scan past the object bounds. MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 requires that uses of the <string.h> functions must not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters. Because there is no check or documented/verified guarantee in the code that File is non-NULL and NUL-terminated, the code can violate Rule 21.17. To fix this, validate File (e.g. ensure File != NULL and use a bounded length such as via an explicit length parameter or a guarded strnlen-like approach) or otherwise ensure by contract that callers can never pass NULL/unterminated buffers.
